Reviews.Title: upgradable to a great ultrabook if you spend some extra $$
Reviews.Author: 00slee
Reviews.Content: At the current price (I paid $529), it is a great value ultrabook. However if you spend some extra money, it will become a great performing notebook.I added 4GB of memory ($40).The installed wireless mini-card is below average, I only got 72Mbps. I bought the Intel AC7260 card (~$35) and now I have BOTH Bluetooth and wireless AC which runs at 866.7Mbps.The HDD w small SSD will give you very fast boot time but you will see occasionally jerkiness when bringing up new apps. I recommend replacing the HDD with a 240GB SSD (~$150).The screen is adequate (768p) for MS office and IE11 but if you want use win8.1 touch to run multi screen apps it will be a little cramped. The touchscreen is very good and responds spot on with my hand.If you want to do any upgrading, please make sure you watch the youtube video on how to open this laptop and upgrade any parts; it is quite easy to do.Now I have an ultrabook which rivals any $1200 4th-gen ultrabooks out there except screen resolution.This notebook is shipped with Win8; so when you boot up, you will probably have a few dozen windows updates to download and install; this may take an hour. After all that is done, look for Win8.1 in the app store; another hour of download and install.

Reviews.Title: Honest Review without any Bias
Reviews.Author: Timothy
Reviews.Content: This laptop will end up on the books as a solid four-star ultrabook unless various "picky" reviewers show up and start downgrading the notebook below that, which can happen. However, as a fairly proficient PC user and one that has never been a "gamer" and thus I have never needed the high-end money laptops I have always searched for an affordable, fast, and stylish laptop that would see be pushing strong after 2 years of solid productivity use. This laptop is an absolute BARGAIN (I got it at 479.00). Anyone that thinks they could get anything with this package for less or the same is not being truthful. I spend hours researched, watching youtube reviews, and etc. I already knew ahead of time based upon reviews what to expect (pro and con) thus I wasn't upset or surprised.PROS:Very Thin and Stylish3rd Generation i5 processor (never go with Celeron or AMD chips, stick with i3-i7. I chose i5 because my other laptop which my wife is getting is a solid i3 so I needed an upgrade)Hybrid SSD Hard Drive (this isn't a full out SSD drive which reflects in the cost. You could easily purchase a full SSD for around 150 but it isn't necessary. This drive does what you need it to do in efficiency and speed. Anyone going from HDD standalone to this will think they are in heaven)Screen Size: Love the 14 inch screen. This is of course what adds a bit more weight to this than other ultrabooks...however I am amused when I see people acting like 4lb total weight is like lugging around a desktop computer)Black Aluminum Top: I don't find it to be a "fingerprint magnet" as many have described. I expected huge greasy smudges after touching it. Yes fingerprints show but not in the greasy way you envision. I don't find this a big deal at all.Touchscreen: Takes a little getting used to at first. Found the screen to be very solid and doesn't really shake when using the touchscreen features. Reflection and glare isn't an issue to me because I typically don't type and work on a laptop out in the park under a blazing sun. This shows fingerprints more than the cover but any touchscreen you use will do that.Fan Noise: Absolutely ZERO. This is one of the quietest laptops I have ever owned.Heat: Like any laptop it will give off heat but I don't find it giving off a ton of heat at all like others I have owned. I always use an aluminum cooler for laptops.Windows 8: Ok I know that I am listing this under "pros" but it isn't really a con or a pro for me. I personally like Windows 7 better but you can immediately install "START8" which gives you the desktop you typically would use in windows 7 or Ultra. I don't need all the extra apps and fluff that Windows 8 uses. However, you get two start menus basically side by side when using "Start 8." One is the APPS screen which you use your touchscreen for and the other is the classic start menu. However...immediately upgrade to the 8.1 version of Windows 8. I found that it fixed a few software kinks I was having.MEMORY: The 4GB memory was fine but I went ahead and ordered 4 GB more (Corsair Vengeance 4GB DDR3 1600mhz (PC3 12800) for around 35 dollars. Very easy to install. Search youtube for a video that shows how to install it. BE SURE YOU are grounded on something so you don't get static output from your hands to the internal components. However, it is PLUG and PLAY memory...super easy...now I have 8GB!)CONS:Wireless: Ok...PLAN ON ORDERING A REPLACEMENT INTERNAL ADAPTER. Just trust me. Every review practically states this and most internet searches reveal major issues with Atheros Qualcomm adapters. I ordered the ($33.99) Intel 7260HMW IEEE 802.11AC, dual-band, 2x2 Wi-Fi - OEM from Newegg since it is a little cheaper and actually ships from the company whereas amazon ships from an external company. Trust me...ORDER THIS! It's either that or plan on sending the laptop in to get them to either replace it with another junky Atheros model and wait all that extra time or be prepared ;) )Keyboard: Ok...it isn't a big deal at all and not a true CON. The keyboard is a little more spongy I guess than other keyboards I've used. However, I'm not a hard key banger so I don't have issues. If you are a huge key slammer you may have to get used to the keyboard. Other than that...I type great with it and don't mind it at all.TRACKPAD: This one takes a little getting used to for me. It is much more sensitive than other laptops I use. However...it is manageable. Just not the old drag and scrape pushpad I consider older laptops to have. Very sensitive and so you learn to just easily use your fingers and no problem. The "click" parts on the bottom of the track pad (right and left) have a little more "click" to them. You will see what I mean when you get the laptop.CONCLUSION:This is only four stars because of the WIFI needs to be replaced which ASUS should take care of. However, I promise you, for the price you cannot find a better laptop with the i5, hybrid SSD, the ability to upgrade to 8gb ram, the style, thinness, touchpad, etc. This is hands down one of the best laptops I have owned in this price range. I would take this any day over many of the other laptops which are higher priced. If anything changes I'll let you know!

Reviews.Title: Replaced my Mac with this. Thought I would cry but smiled instead!
Reviews.Author: Beth Spears "Beth"
Reviews.Content: My MacBook is seven years old and on its last leg. I needed something relatively inexpensive and sturdy since I travel a lot. I wanted (needed?) a computer that could compare to my beloved MacBook. Mournfully, I researched EVERY computer within this price range and this computer gives the most bang for the buck. It's light enough. The computer is very sturdy (almost as sturdy as the MacBook Air). When I looked at computers in person, I would try to flex the cover to see how much give it has. This has none which made me feel more confident in buying it. It does, like another reviewer said, show finger prints like mad. I keep my hands clean and lotion-free but it looks like I've been digging in a fried chicken bucket and then palming my computer.Windows 8 isn't as bad as I thought it would be. It takes some getting used to but gives the computer the feel of a tablet. If you use that mindset, you'll be ok. The 8.1 update was supposed to give you the option to have the computer open to the desktop but I haven't figured that out yet. I actually prefer my computer to open to the tiles page rather than the desktop since it makes it look a lot less like my work laptop. It has taken me longer to get used to the touchpad since I'm used to swiping down to scroll down a page and with this you have to swipe up.The only complaint that I have (other than the fried chicken cover), which might not be a big deal to most, is the keyboard is kind of spongy. The keys take a tab bit more effort to hit than what I'm used to. It makes me feel like I'm typing all angry-like.I have been getting about 5+ hours out of the battery but I don't hang out online all the time. If you are surfing or streaming movies, the battery will probably last about 3 hours. I would recommend this computer to anyone, even diehard Mac users like my old self.

Reviews.Title: Fantastic laptop for budget-conscious with decent power and portability
Reviews.Author: Tim "tlee328"
Reviews.Content: Summary: This is a perfect laptop for budget-conscious folks who want decent power and portability at a low-cost.So far, I believe this to be one of the best bangs for your buck in terms of thin/light PC laptops. I was personally also looking at the Aspire S3 which was in a similar price range and about 1 lb lighter. I'll list my primary reasons for purchase and how I chose between the two later:My primary criteria for selection with a new laptop:* A 3rd generation i5 or higher/later (and I checked passmark.com on benchmarks repeatedly, debating with myself)* At least 4GB RAM (upgradeable to higher preferred obviously)* Either 13.3" or 14" screen-size - to me, this is the sweet-spot for functional and portable* Portability/lightness* Fast boot-up* Minimum of 4.5 hrs battery life (e.g. a flight coast-to-coast in the U.S., not including take-off/landing)* PC - Windows; and despite the concern over Win 8.x, I preferred to get the latest OS just out of longevity* USB 3.0 port(s), HDMI; an RJ45 (preferred, just for wired situations)* Cost: In the $500 range or lower* Something that should hopefully last at least 2 years with reasonable performanceIt was a really tough battle for me to decide between this and the Acer Aspire S3 (391-6811), but here were my deciding factors between this and the S3:- Touchscreen- Upgradeability for RAM (8GB max vs. S3's 4GB max)- Slightly higher price for S3 with similar internal specs (at least when I purchased)The competing S3 was lighter, has a slightly better CPU (i5-3337 vs. i5-3317) and probably a better wi-fi card. I loved the form factor on the S3 too, but am pretty fond of the S400CA's looks too now. Both were upgradeable in terms of changing to a full-on Solid State Drive (SSD)-- but for the value, the S400CA seemed like too good a deal to pass up. Obviously, I'd prefer a true SSD, but the Hybrid SSD (which is present in both models) does work decently well in boot-ups at least in my first week of use.The Cons - everything always has some trade-offs; I personally found these acceptable:- WiFi card isn't the greatest; some other comments have mentioned this. It is replaceable for relatively cheap though.- Resolution: it's pretty much 'standard' resolution, but definitely many premier ultrabooks have way better (again, price is a factor)- You will almost certainly have to do a lot of Windows updates (first on Windows 8.0, and then to 8.1) after purchasing. I am not used to Windows 8.x myself, but am growing to get used to it honestly. I don't think it's as bad as some people say, though my two cents is that I wish it integrated with non-Microsoft stuff better - e.g. Google Calendar (which I use frequently)- At about 4 lbs, it isn't the lightest laptop (though definitely light enough IMHO)- 2 of the 3 USB ports are USB 2.0 for whatever reason (but at least one of them was made into USB 3.0, right?)- Yes, the screen lid and the screen itself does get smudgy. Not a deal killer in my opinion as of yet.Also, may not be relevant for everyone and mileage may vary, but I ordered on a Sunday from Amazon as a Prime member with two-day shipping. This may not happen for everyone, but I was pleasantly surprised when it not only shipped on Sunday, but arrived at my house the next day (Monday). That has got to be one of the most incredible, fastest buy-to-receive times I've ever had without paying for one-day shipping. Thank you, Amazon!If you're trying to get a laptop on budget, to me, this seems like a good deal. If anything bad happens, I'll try to update my review though. You generally get what you pay for, but in my opinion, you're getting a strong value for this package.

Reviews.Title: I should have known better!
Reviews.Author: paulicious21
Reviews.Content: This is my second laptop from ASUS. My first one had problems. I dismissed it as a dud giving ASUS the benefit of the doubt. This one has been even worse. Here is what to expect if you buy this laptop. Other users have had the same problems.Problem #1: Mouse Pad. It doesn't work. Two fingers are supposed to scroll down the page. It worked the first day and then worked off and on after that. Now it is completely broken. Also you have to push down on the mouse pad just right to select anything. It's a real pain.Problem #2: Aside from the fact that it doesn't have a back-lit keyboard the keys don't work. I have to pound them to get them to work. Come on, that's ridiculous.Problem #3: This by far the worst problem of all. My computer shuts off randomly. One reviewer described hearing a click right before it shuts down. I have had the same problem. It also makes a funny noise. Since the fan is the only moving part it has been deemed defective. The fan sounds like its going to break all the time. I talked to an IT guy about this and because of the way Ultra books are built the motherboard will most likely need to be replaced along with the fan.Like I said before, these problems are not unique. Others have had the same issues. My advice is stay away from ASUS. It's not worth the headache I currently have because of them.

Reviews.Title: Wonderful! A great deal!
Reviews.Author: Jamie T
Reviews.Content: It's like a macbook but for half the price! I was a bit hesitant at first (since it's Windows 8) ... but I figured that I would 'catch up' with technology and plus I figured it would be great for school so I purchased it.It's definitely a steal for what you're getting (i5 processor, super lightweight, etc. I don't really know much about computers except for the basics).Since I'm still not really used to Windows 8, I decided to install the Windows 7 classic shell..WALAH! Problem solved! :)Pros:i5 processorVersatileStarts up in ~5 secondsVery responsive touchscreenLightweightComes with a relatively small chargerLOOOVE the two finger scroll & other various 'smart gestures'. Just makes everything EASIER.Very fast, I can run multiple programs at onceCons:You will get your fingerprints on the black aluminum cover. The best way to clean it is with a microfiber clothThe brightness level is mehNo backlit keys (may be a con for some)Sometimes the smart gesture will not be turned on (for me at least). To fix this problem, just search up 'smart gesture' on computer and launch ASTPcenter. From there you can also customize your settings with the touchpad.I've had it for about 2-3 weeks now and I haven't had major issues with it. Battery life is ok, about 2-4 hours depending on laptop activity.Love love love it! I would definitely recommend this beaut.

Reviews.Title: love it!
Reviews.Author: Payton Rudolph
Reviews.Content: This laptop is very light and easy to transport. It's the perfect size! Love the touch screen, which is very responsive, and the display is wonderful. Still getting used to windows 8 though.

Reviews.Title: Nice computer/ Wireless integrated card is useless
Reviews.Author: Charlie
Reviews.Content: I have been using my new ASUS Vivobook for at least 2 weeks. I have to say that is a good product for the price:1. Nice design.2. Very fast boot up.3. I am new in windows 8 interface but is not as bad as other people say. I kind of like it.4. Multi gestures mouse pad is amazing.5. It comes with Intel hd 4000 graphics. ( Info not provided by Amazon product description)CON:Everything was good until I started to get some problems with my internet connection. I mainly use my computer in my bedroom which is 10 meters away from the router. The internet connection is just horrible. After trying my internet speed in other devices ( computers, phones, etc) My internet service was just perfect. There is other people claiming the same problems with the wireless card on this computer.Today I received a USB wireless adapter and now my internet is fine, I will change the integrated card in a future so I don't have to occupy a USB slot to get decent internet connection.For a brand new product is unacceptable that such a cheap wireless card comes with a nice PC.

Reviews.Title: good choice
Reviews.Author: mani
Reviews.Content: beautiful thin laptop..no wifi problem till now...and mine has intel 4000..no issues wid win 8...touch is very responsive...and it makes no noise...

Reviews.Title: Have some issues but overall amazing product
Reviews.Author: cis
Reviews.Content: I got this laptop for $450 the day before the black Friday deal week started. Got it soon after that but I traveled somewhere else so I just started using it yesterday. I have been using the laptop for two days,and here are some of the issues I have:1. The smart gesture stops working after a while. It came back after I reboot it, but it disappears again for no reason. It can be quite annoying after getting used to scrolling down pages using easy two finger gesture, but it does not really matter that much.2. The keyboard does take a little while to get used to, but to be honest,the only issue is the space key. It is so easy to miss spaces using the space key on this laptop. I was a little disappointed at first, but then I just pushed a bit harder than other keys. All the other keys are fine. It takes a little while to get used to the keyboard, but other than the space key,they are pretty easy to type on.3. The resolution is not high enough to watch HD movies, but they are very standard and I am fine with it.4. This laptop can get a little slow if you open like 10 browsers even if it has i5 processor.The laptop is very thin to me, and not heavy at all probably because I have never had an ultra book in my life. It looks very stylish and the touch screen is amazing. It is a great bargain for me with that price. It does everything I need, checking emails, writing codes, watching youtube videos... Also, I have no issue with the wifi, which was a big concern for me when I purchased it since I have read so many bad reviews about the wifi.

Reviews.Title: really good bang for your buck
Reviews.Author: Ms. T
Reviews.Content: I didn't buy this from Amazon because they ran out of stock really early, so I bought it from another web seller as I really wanted two of these for christmas presents for my kids.  So far, in only a few days of ownership, I am really impressed with both.  Neither one had any keyboard issues and surprisingly, both seem to have rock solid wifi even at a great distance from the router.  I noticed that the two I received have the Atheros wifi adapter, and I think that maybe some of the earlier units had another lesser known brand wifi adapter (I will update later if it does start dropping signal regularly).  I myself have a Sony Vaio 14" Ultrabook, and even though these Asus are considerably less expensive, I like them almost as much and don't feel like too much was sacrificed to meet a lower price point.Things that are better about the Asus laptops - the core i5 processor is considerably zippier than my older i3 vaio.  Also, I actually prefer the keyboard on the Asus to that of the Vaio, as the keys don't require as hard a keypress to register - likewise for the trackpad - a light touch is all it takes to register.  I can also touch type on the Asus keyboard easier than I can on the Vaio - I think the keyboard on the Asus is just slightly bigger which makes it easier to touch type on.  Also, the Asus laptops came with significantly less crapware pre-installed and they were kind enough to make most of it optional thru their software installer app.  I wish all pc manufacturers would do this.Things that I like better about my Vaio than these Asus - the screen. While all three have the same resolution screen, the Vaio screen looks better. The Asus screens look fine, just not as good as the more expensive ultrabooks.  Also, the Vaio has  a quieter fan, hard drive, and other internals which makes it obvious that it is a more expensive higher quality laptop.  Not that these are loud by any means, just not absolutely silent like my Vaio is.All-in-all, you really can't go wrong with these Asus ultrabooks if you are looking for a low cost entry into the touchscreen ultrabook arena.

Reviews.Title: Wanted Better
Reviews.Author: Brent Lee
Reviews.Content: I really wanted to like this laptop. Before purchasing this product, I did quite a bit of research and determined that this laptop is a great value. Plus it carries the ASUS name, which from my experience in building desktop computers - ASUS is a quality manufacturer.The Good: The build quality is outstanding and the form is slim and very classy looking. The speakers are also great for being laptop speakers. Has an SSD for the operating system so it boots quickly.The Bad: It has Windows 8, I would prefer it to be available with Windows 7.The Ugly : Unfortunately it did not work properly. Even after installing the latest Windows updates, the newest drivers, and changing the power settings to "maximum performance", the computer constantly dropped the wireless signal. I have an iPad, an older Lenovo laptop and a Roku on this wireless network and dropping signal is never an issue on any of these devices. Also upon turning the computer on it displays this same message every time "Your PC ran into a problem. This problem caused your PC to restart." The computer is three days old and I have not tinkered with any critical systems, I expected a much better performance than this.My Verdict: I don't know if I received a lemon or if Windows 8 is the source of these problems, therefore I am giving the product 3 stars. Apple gains another sale - all of the Windows laptops I like come equipped with Windows 8, so I am instead going to purchase a MacBook Air.

Reviews.Title: it didnt work properly since the first day
Reviews.Author: Richbame
Reviews.Content: This PC did not work ok since the first day. The trackpad looses its configuration every other day, I had to format it after 2 weeks of purchase it, and it goes off by it shelf once every 10 times i use it, it is not normal for a new computer. I wanted to give it a second chance but is inpossible to work or do something on it. The worst is that Amazon does not give me an option to return it or exchange. i hoppe with this comment they will contact me

Reviews.Title: Bad experience with this computer and this dealer.
Reviews.Author: Mengjiao li
Reviews.Content: I would rate it as zero star if possible.I bought this computer in Jan from Mirrorsystem on amazon at a price of $553.After I got it, I found something wrong with its battery. Without charging, it only last 2-3 hours(even during which I worked on Word, and searched the Internet. No video, no games).  The most bizzar thing is,  it would then die suddenly without any warnings about the battery, and u can't open it again if not plug in quickly. So I contacted the asus technique support. They instructed me to test it simply, but it did not work any better. Then I contacted mirrosystem for return and refund. They said they would return me the money in 3-5 days after they get the computer, but in fact I only got around $430 after 3 week!!! They charged me $120 for so called restoring fee...

Reviews.Title: Try to get a used one
Reviews.Author: Psyc Researcher "W. James"
Reviews.Content: I got this from Amazon Warehouse for about $450 and I think it was a great deal. As everyone reports, the wireless card is sub par. It's not horrendous, but it will drop signals from time to time. Certainly, enough to warrant a replacement. I got the card listed below for $23. I also upgraded RAM to 8 GB with the model RAM listed below. That cost me $51. So, for a total of $525, I feel like I have a laptop that should last me several years. Because the wireless card is bad, you'll probably be able to get a used model pretty easily (a lot of people probably send these back) and do the upgrades yourself.Intel Network 6235AN.HMWWB Centrino WiFi Card Half Mini PCI Express Advanced-N 6235 Dual Band BluetoothCorsair Vengeance 4GB (1x4GB) DDR3 1600 MHz (PC3 12800) Laptop Memory (CMSX4GX3M1A1600C9)

Reviews.Title: good but a let down at some plases
Reviews.Author: Richard W. Reutti "Red"
Reviews.Content: this is a great entry level pc my sister wanted it to play minecraft on and let me tell you i mannaged a mere 5 fps on low settingsotherwise this computer is good

Reviews.Title: Incredible Laptop for the Price
Reviews.Author: Christopher Dietsch
Reviews.Content: I received this laptop as a Christmas gift from my dad. I'm starting programming classes soon and all my computer science major friends told me that having my own laptop is extremely helpful. My dad told me that he bought it for under $450, so I will review it as a $450 laptop.I'll start with the good things, of which there are a lot of.-Aesthetics. The build quality and design of the laptop is beautiful. Seems quite sturdy, but I have yet to drop it (and I don't plan to). Both closed and open, it's a very sexy laptop. Of course, beauty is in the eye of the beholder, and this is only my personal opinion on this matter. Results may vary. The display is bright and colorful, and there is not much of a difference in quality when viewing at an odd angle. The aluminum back DOES attract fingerprints, but they wipe off easily with a soft cloth (one should come with the laptop if bought new).-Speed/Performance. The laptop is super quick. You really can't beat the 24 gig solid state drive and i5 processor for the price. It boots almost instantly and is completely ready to go within seconds. Everything I've done on it so far has been speedy, but I haven't started school yet, nor have I started programming with it, so we'll see how that goes. It has 4 gigs of RAM, but you can easily upgrade it to 8 if you so desire. I have not done so yet, but considering how cheap RAM is nowadays, why not?-Windows 8/Touchscreen combo. Believe it or not, I am including this as a good thing. I'm somewhat surprised at how natural it feels to use the touchscreen in combination with the keyboard and touchpad, and WIndows 8 makes it possible. Yes, some of the UI choices Microsoft made with 8 are a bit... frivolous, and I find myself rolling my eyes every once in a while, but it is an OS best suited for a touchscreen PC such as this one, and they wok beautifully in tandem. However, after you learn all the quirks with the OS, you get used to it and it sort of grows on you. If you download 8.1, the desktop functions almost identically with 7. Both the touchscreen and the touchpad are very responsive, and the touchpad is very intuitive, allowing you to click by just tapping or pressing down.-The price. Well, technically I got it for free. So.. yeah. But still an amazing value.Now, the bad. Before I begin, let me state that the good aspects of this computer far outweigh the bad, especially for the price.-The keyboard. This is definitely my biggest complaint with the laptop. It feels very.. mushy, is the best word for it. I think I saw some other reviews use this exact word and it is very accurate. There is very little haptic feedback and it is easy to press a key and "miss" it, so to speak. I am typing this review on the laptop and I just missed the O in laptop and the T in typing. Perhaps it just takes some readjustments in typing habits (AKA I have to learn to type with more than my two index fingers and my thumb), but for now, it's a bit irritating. It is also not backlit, which some might find to be annoying. I personally don't care, but I thought it might be useful to note for some people.That's all I have to say about that. I can't comment on the battery life because I haven't unplugged it for any extended period of time yet, but I'm assuming that it will not be much of an issue even if it is short, as almost every single building I will go to has outlets.Overall, very, very good laptop for the price. If you can get it for under $500, go for it. I'm sure there are some things I missed in my review, but I hope that you found it helpful. Good luck with your search!

Reviews.Title: Great Ultrabook!
Reviews.Author: MilfordChris
Reviews.Content: I needed a new, very portable laptop for my work.  I researched and researched, checked all the online store sites and decided on this S400CA Asus ultrabook.  It is a great computer.  It is very quick and so far handles all the applications I use with ease.  I did immediately add 4 GB of RAM and a used Bluetooth wireless bought elsewhere.  It knew it now had Bluetooth capability as soon as I rebooted the computer.  After a month, I am very happy with my choice.

Reviews.Title: Very nice laptop
Reviews.Author: SAMSUNG 7.0
Reviews.Content: I have been using my new ASUS Vivobook for 5 weeks. It is a good product for the price: $449.00.1. Nice design. Smooth edges.2.  It has both SSD and HDD. Very fast boot up. It takes only 10 to 12 seconds.3. Core i5-3317U 1.7 GHz processor.4. I am new in windows 8 but  I like it.5. Multi gestures mouse pad is amazing.6. Touchscreen is very responsive. It comes with Intel HD 4000 graphics.I have the same issue with WIFI disconnected sometimes but I replaced it with Intel Network 6235AN.HMWWB Centrino WiFi Card Advanced-N 6235 Dual Band Bluetooth for less than $24: B007QXLIWIThe issue has been fixed and my laptop also has very good Bluetooth, now. I am very happy with my purchase and I love my laptop very much.

Reviews.Title: Great laptop for the price
Reviews.Author: Jonathan
Reviews.Content: Overall this is a great laptop for the price.Pros:- i5 core processor (Upgrading to 8.1 will speed it up)- Very responsive touchscreen- the sleek metal design- does not heat up too much and the fan is pretty quiet- Very thin for a 14 inch laptop- good price for what you are gettingCons:- I am not sure if this is just my product, but the spacebar is very hard to use. I have to press it really hard in the center of the spacebar for it to properly work. Pressing the spacebar's edges will not work at all. Also, the keyboardfeels very "squishy". Pressing a little bit harder than usual in the center will cause the keyboard to cave in a bit. But the Chiclet design and the spacing between the keys are good.- Battery life isn't the greatest- screen is not very bright even at highest- At 1.7 ghz, it will not run your favorite games without lag spikes (Skyrim, Borderlands, Battle Field 4, etc.)- wifi is not the best, will upgrade it soonOverall, this is a great laptop for the price of around $550. I would recommend this to someone who would like a decently fast, very sharp looking, and thin laptop that can do some light gaming.

Reviews.Title: So far so good!
Reviews.Author: TeePee
Reviews.Content: I have had this for about 3 weeks. I have added 4 GBs of memory and upgraded Windows to 8.1.  So far I have had no issues.  I was going to update and drivers and Bios but since Device Manager says everything is working I figured I'd leave it alone for now.  I did order a wifi card anticipating I was going to have connectivity issues as a few others have had but so far there haven't been any.  It could be because I have only done web browsing and software downloads, don't know but now I have a spare on hand in case I develop connectivity problems.  For the money I spent ($450), I think I got a decent laptop.  So price vs feature/function and no problems is the reason for my rating.  Hopefully, I won't encounter any of the issues others have posted.  Windows 8 takes some getting use to but the more I use it, I'm beginning to like it.  Plus I can still use the Desktop when I want.

Reviews.Title: Wi-fi connectivity problem, never got resolved
Reviews.Author: Sambitesh
Reviews.Content: I don't know if it is the problem with Windows 8 or this laptop - but the wifi signal drops pretty frequently. When I received it, it was dropping every hour. Then I contacted customer care. They made me reinstall the device driver and the problem became worse - it started dropping every 5 mins. I contacted them again - the re-installed the BIOS. No improvement.When I contacted them again I was advised to refresh Windows 8 - which at least made the problem as bad as it was.I have had this laptop for just two days. I will try fixing the problem. After that I will write a more complete review.Update 1 - Sending my laptop to ASUS for detailed analysis.Update 2 - I haven't received it back. ASUS says that they have no idea when will they send it back to me. They declined a refund too. I am pretty sure even if I recieve it back someday, the problem wouldn't be fixed at all, I am convinced of their incompetency . What a terrible decision it was to do business with ASUS

Reviews.Title: LOVE IT!
Reviews.Author: Ana Z.
Reviews.Content: LOVE IT! it's beautiful, light and really cool! it works perfectly and the touchscreen is just a delight! would buy it again!

Reviews.Title: Great Value, Good Performance
Reviews.Author: KB
Reviews.Content: I have been using my ASUS laptop for about a month and I'm very pleased. I chose this for its touch screen at a price significantly lower than what I could find elsewhere. I am still getting used to Windows 8, but am overall OK with the adjustment. I definitely recommend that you update (I think it was called Windows 8.1 or something) right away as it is an improvement over the basic version. My only complaint with Windows 8 is that my phone and tablet are Android so I do almost everything (email, calendar, etc) through Google apps and they are not well supported on Windows Store. I find myself using Chrome to access Gmail and Google Calendar through the web, which is fine.The laptop is lightweight and very portable, and the screen size is the perfect balance of size. I had a brief issue with the touchpad scrolling, but a restart seems to have fixed that issue. I recommend this laptop for home use at a great value.

Reviews.Title: Great value laptop!!
Reviews.Author: Anvin
Reviews.Content: I fully agree with Timothy's review.. I got this at $479 too and I still think this is a steal.. Great value for money..I had a couple of observations with mine though..1) Its been a couple of days since I got this laptop. I had no problems at all with the wi-fi the past two days. I upgraded to Windows 8.1 today. My wi-fi already disconnected 3 times post the upgrade. This could have been coincidental with problems with my router, so I need to observe this for a couple of days to come to a conclusion.2) I always thought this had a Intel-UMA graphics card. Amazon says so but the device manager in my laptop says its Intel HD Graphics 4000, which I think it's better than UMA. Any thoughts on this ?3) The keys are a little spaced out and you need to get used to typing on this. No big deal..Overall, I like this product very much and extremely happy that I made the purchase..

Reviews.Title: My son loves it
Reviews.Author: Stacy Brown "Olystacy"
Reviews.Content: My son specifically asked for this laptop as he loves to play minecraft. He says it is quick and not laggy. He loves it and has not had any issues with it all. Seemed like a good quality product at a reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: Technical service of ASUS is a disaster
Reviews.Author: Augusto Cucala
Reviews.Content: Last December 2013 I bought my ASSUS Vivo Book S400CA at Amazon US.  The computer arrived fine and as I was told it came with Windows 8.  One month after I got it, I did the upgrade to windows 8.1.  After two months the computer did not allow me to shut down.  Every time I wanted to shut down the PC I got a blue screen and an error message.  The only way to shut down the computer was to “suspend it”.  During the past 4 months the problems have been increasing.  After a while none of the programs of Microsoft Office would not work.  Every time I tried to open one program of the office package the computer would try to validate the software with Microsoft.  The ASUS computer was so unstable that every software package felt they were in different computers every time I started a given program.With all these problems I called the Technical Service of ASUS.  I called the technical Service of Asus in Spain because I moved to Spain.  They asked to send them the Serial Number, the Guarantee and the invoice, which I did.  I sent al the requested documents and after two weeks of going back and forth they told me that they will not fix my computer because the invoice of Amazon US did not have my Tax or ID number on it. I tried to explain to them that Amazon US makes the invoices that way but no luck!!What a disaster of Service!!  I cannot recommend to anyone that they purchase any equipment from ASUS.  If you have a problems, you are in your own, no help from the manufacturer. NO HELP AT ALL.We also had a problem with an ASUS tablet ASUS VivoTab Smart ME400C-C1-BK.  The tablet once a week would all of a sudden go to a blue screen and you would lose everything and have to start all over again.  We called the technical people at ASUS in Spain and they again, did not want to take care of the tablet.  They told us in addition that it was our fault because we upgraded from windows 8 to windows 8.1, and we were supposed to use always the original software from the manufacturer.  Can you believe this comment!ASUS sure knows how to upset and loose customers!  To start with, they just lost the 6 members of my family.

Reviews.Title: new Asus VivoBook S400CA
Reviews.Author: Natalia
Reviews.Content: I chose this ultrabook because it was the most complete regarding RAM, hard drive storage and size, but I thought that it would be a little lighter because of being  an ultrabook.Apart from the weight I really liked this computer.

Reviews.Title: Waste of Money
Reviews.Author: Courtney McElvogue
Reviews.Content: I have never had a worse computer than this one. The mouse started screwing up a month after I purchased it and I could not get the support website for Asus to go anywhere. I contacted them on Twitter and even though I explained the first time that their website did not work, their response was ,"Have you tried our support website to help you with your problem?" This company is a joke. If I want to get help from them, I have to provide the serial number. One problem with that: my computer doesn't have the sticker on the bottom of it and they will not help you at all without that number. I hate this computer and I would love to use it for target practice with a shotgun. My other issues are that the keyboard doesn't type all the letters even though I hit the buttons. It drops the WiFi connection all the time and it's not the router. I have had it drop the connection from three different routers. My latest issue, I downloaded a program and had to restart the computer. It wouldn't load anything and if it did, it took about five minutes. It deleted all of my cookies and most of the apps on Windows 8 won't work now. This compute has given me nothing but problems. Asus has stopped contacting me back and have not tried to help me resolve these issues at all.

Reviews.Title: Disappointed
Reviews.Author: Emily
Reviews.Content: The computer was packed well and looked great. However the harddrive was damaged and it took a total of 15 days (1 day after their return policy for anything defective) to completely break down. Contacted the seller Mirrorsymmetry and they would not budge on a refund without charging 20-50% restocking fee. Had to contact Asus and pay to send it to California to be fixed. This computer was meant to be a gift for my parents, who needed a computer quickly and was a complete disappointment for everyone involved. Will never use this seller again.

Reviews.Title: reasonable price with reasonable performance
Reviews.Author: Seungwoo Lee
Reviews.Content: good performance and fast booting time thanks to 24gb ssdmight be hard to find something better with this price (546$)

Reviews.Title: It was a $460 mistake
Reviews.Author: Arnieosp
Reviews.Content: I bough this laptop on Amazon in December of '13. I am getting more and more disappointed with it. Out of the box the wi-fi card was just garbage. I knew that before I bought the computer, so I replaced the OEM wi-fi card with an Intel one, huge improvement. The most annoying thing is the keyboard. I constantly miss letters located in the middle of the keyboard, unless I really pound on them.Recently it started turning itself off without warning. So, as I am working on something it suddenly goes "click" and everything immediately dies. The when I push the on/off button, it goes through several cycles of "scanning and repairing the disk", then "installing updates", etc. I have to sit and wait for 15-20 min until it fires up.I will contact the ASUS Customer Service next week and send it in. So, if I had to do it all over again, I would have never bought it.

Reviews.Title: sleek, a bit unconvenient
Reviews.Author: Thao Do
Reviews.Content: good in general, sleek look! the typing board is a bit uncomfortable. and the audio is not really good for music. the other function is great

Reviews.Title: Average Notebook Made Excellent with Inexpensive Upgrades
Reviews.Author: OlympusRan
Reviews.Content: I've had this for a few months. With the price dropping this was an excellent choice for a laptop. The 4 GB 1600 MHz RAM is embedded leaving an available slot for expansion. I recommend 8 GB 1600 memory giving the laptop 12 GB. I also replaced the hard drive with a solid state 250 GB. Last, I upgraded the wireless card to an AC-wireless with Bluetooth. With these upgrades this laptop rivals many laptops twice it's price. Surprising to me was the quality of the sound from the speakers.The only cons about this laptop are:- Intel HD graphics 4000 card is not the latest and has performance limitations- 4 cell battery boasts 44Whrs and only lasts 4-5 hours of continual use- Only one USB 3.0 port

Reviews.Title: fast boot, light weight and good design
Reviews.Author: anthony wainaina
Reviews.Content: I liked the product. I purchased used, but computer was as described. Booting is super fast, and the processor also handles navigation and domestic usage pretty well. computer is thin and light, which helps carrying it around. Screen resolution is 4k. i don't know how much better that 1080 pixels that is, but i love the clarity. A little disappointed with Battery life. it is described as 5 hrs, however, with full charge, it only gives about 3 1/2 - 4 hrs. Comes with windows 8, but i couldn't not get it to Upgrade to windows 8.1 from Microsoft free upgrade offered for all windows 8 computers.Overall, the computer is great.

Reviews.Title: nice product
Reviews.Author: alper
Reviews.Content: Product was nice, I bought it about 550$ and it is really a good product with this price.And it has no problems such as "space key" or wireless connection (I updated directly to win 8.1)

Reviews.Title: Love This Asus S400CA Like It Was Chocolate Cake
Reviews.Author: sojodave
Reviews.Content: I searched way too long for a laptop for my home use.  I have a nice Samsung laptop for work with an i7.  I didn't want to come home to a dog laptop.  I did a few upgrades in the first evening of owning this laptop and now it is crazy fast.  After spending three hours updating stuff and upgrading to Windows 8.1, I did the following upgrades.* Kingston Now V330 120 SSD drive kit.  The kit made it easy to clone your old hard drive and copy it to the new drive and it made such a huge difference.  I'm getting 7.9 for hard drive on Windows Experience.* Kingston 1600 4GB ram* 6235 Wifi/Bluetooth cardAll the upgrades went smooth after I found out how to boot to an external disk drive from the bios.  When I close the lid and open it up again, it boots before I can even take my hand off the screen.I was concerned about the screen because some reviews said it was washed out.  My screen is not washed out and text and photos look sharp.  There is reflection, but the screen isn't a fingerprint magnet even though it is touch screen.  The keyboard is easy for me to type on.  At first I didn't care for the keypad.  After upgrading to windows 8.1 and updating the driver, I now love it.  I like the windows gestures and the three finger swipe to show everything is running is awesome.  After my upgrades, I spent a total of $590 for a rocking laptop.

Reviews.Title: Good laptop for the money
Reviews.Author: Miguel
Reviews.Content: This is a very sleek laptop, but feels very sturdy. My two small issues with this laptop are:1. It's a little on the heavy side for an ultrabook2. The screen isn't the best out thereHowever, considering the price, this is a great laptop.

Reviews.Title: Very nice product
Reviews.Author: jn
Reviews.Content: I purchased this notebook about 3 months ago and it has been performing quite well since.  Wi-Fi is robust, will connect just about anywhere.  Easy to carry, but a bit heavier than a tablet.  Touch screen freezes from time to time, reboot is the cure.  Others have criticized the finger print issue on the aluminum outer case but it wipes off cleanly with Windex on a paper towel, as does the touch screen.  Excellent value.

Reviews.Title: Slow performance, mediocre touchpad, HORRIBLE customer service.
Reviews.Author: Nicholas C. Barnes
Reviews.Content: Upon receiving my VivoBook from Amazon as a gift, the product was defective right out of the box.  I sent the product in to be repaired, and received my laptop back with a mis-partitioned HDD, my SDD had been taken out, and the screen cracked.  The touchpad is horrendous, and often leads me to become horribly frustrated.  The ASUS customer service is horrible.  I informed them I am a full-time student - I received a DEFECTIVE product, sent it in to get fixed, was repaired WRONG - and that I couldn't go another two weeks without my PC due to classes.  They basically told me tough, and Amazon told me the only way I can return the laptop is if the person who purchased it is aware of me returning it, as they purchased it from some type of vendor on Amazon.Horrible experience all the way around.  Amazon failed me, Asus failed to live up to their name, and now I am stuck with a cheap-a** laptop that has a 500+ price tag.  AVOID this product!

Reviews.Title: Excellent product. Reasonable price. Great service.
Reviews.Author: abidkhanusa
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent product, which is reasonably priced. Additionally, Amazon provides a great and reliable service. I bought this device as a gift for my sister. She absolutely loves this notebook.

Reviews.Title: My thoughts
Reviews.Author: etiennez0r
Reviews.Content: Score for this item separated in different aspects, score from 1 to 5- Overal: 4.6--------------------------------------------- Screen size: 5- Touchscreen presicion: 4- Trackpad: 4- Keyboard: 5- Weight: 5- Size: 5- Performance and processing: 5- Operating system: 3- Look and feel: 5- Price-relation: 5Details: i'm replacing a previous i5 asus with this, my old war tank was almost double in weght, and slower.This baby is fast, the screen size of 14" is perfect (my old was 15").The look and feel is similar to a macbook.The keyboard is pretty good,Windows 8 is ok for me since i'm coming from w7.The problems i've found so far:1) i've losed connectivity to my ad hoc wifi network after i've upgraded to windows 8.1.2) i've tried to reset factory settings, so i could get back to 8.0 but i just couldn't get the factory settings again (it keeps asking for an image that i don't have), so i've stayed into w8.1 and now i've to buy a router to fix my wifi problems since i can't use my old ad hoc network.Those problems are very particular and most related to software, so i don't blame this beaty ultrabook for that..Giving it 5 starts!

Reviews.Title: Great laptop - After replacing WIFI card
Reviews.Author: Tom
Reviews.Content: Great looking laptop. Purchased to replace a Gateway laptop that I received during Black Friday shopping that was crashing. So far the Asus laptop has been rock solid.Here are my Pro/Cons:Pros:1) Looks great.2) Entire laptop has a very solid feeling to it. Almost the whole enclosure is made of metal.  It doesn't have the 'rickety' hinge for the LCD screen where it seems like it's going to snap in have if you open it too quick (I experienced this on some cheaper dells).3) Pretty good specs, but can be better (See other Cons & thoughts).Cons:1) The WIFI network card that comes with the laptop is absolutely terrible. I never encountered any sort of modern device (Phone/laptop) that took longer than a 56k Modem to load a webpage (Not joking...).  I ended up buying a Bigfoot Network KillerN 1202 for $50 shipped and picked up the ability to use the 5 Ghz spectrum as a result. Web pages load just as quick as they do on my Gaming desktop computer and I matched Upload/Download rates on it as well.2) Laptop could use more memory (Not really a major issue). Uses 40% when browsing and around 77% when doing Windows Update.Other Thoughts/Suggestions:Overall I am pleased with my purchase. Picked this up for some programming courses in College and keeping up with things at work. Was slightly disappointed in the performance of the Original WIFI card and deducted a star as a result. I suggest to purchase a replacement alongside the laptop; Takes only a few minutes to replace and it ( Can find instructions on YouTube. Just have to remove the screws on the bottom, use a credit card to separate/open the laptop and then unscrew/replace the wifi card ).

Reviews.Title: report
Reviews.Author: Lado
Reviews.Content: very nice ultra book, simple and usefulwith external bd/dvd/cd and usb hub ( I bought anker USB 3.0 7-Port Hub ) it giving a lot of possibilities for productive work and rest

Reviews.Title: LOVE IT
Reviews.Author: Terri Awoko
Reviews.Content: This is a great LAPTOP, and can handle all the day to day task with no problem asus did me gooddddddd.

Reviews.Title: returned due to wifi issues
Reviews.Author: Marcello
Reviews.Content: after spending hours on the phone with ASUS tech support and doing 2 factory resets I still could not get the wifi to stop dropping out.  Two other laptops in the house and numerous other wifi enabled devices have no problems with my current Belkin router.  Finally gave up and sent it back.  The price was great if only the wifi worked correctly.

Reviews.Title: good quality laptop
Reviews.Author: robert m bielby
Reviews.Content: not excited to have windows 8 but having the 14"  size screen and touch screen is a nice feature.  the one negative no dvd player can be satisfied with a portable dvd player

Reviews.Title: Loving it!
Reviews.Author: Slimpickenz
Reviews.Content: I purchased this product in mid-December and have been using it since then. After reading other reviews, I upgraded the memory to 8 MB, which was very simple, and changed the network card. I have not had any major problem to date, and absolutely love the touch-screen interface. The chassis feels pretty durable, and am not worried about fingerprints on the lid, since it is facing away from me 90% of the time. The keyboard is easy to type on, and feels pretty natural to me. I have to admit, the new Windows OS took a bit to get used to, but I really enjoy it. I am not a power user, as far as games go, but I did install Guild Wars 2, and at low settings, it's runs without a hitch. It is more than capable of performing all of the tasks that I have thrown at it, and transitioning from one app to another is seamless. I would highly recommend this ultrabook to anyone not wanting to spend a lot of money on a great ultrabook.

Reviews.Title: Good Value in an Ultrabook
Reviews.Author: Danwill
Reviews.Content: I bought this Ultrabook for Christmas to replace an 8-year, 8 lb., 15.4" Gateway centrino laptop.  I wanted a faster, light-weight computer for travelling.  This is my first Asus and it appears to be well built.  The computer boots fast due to the hybrid drive and the Windows tiles remind me of a tablet.  After reading many of the reviews prior to my purchase, I bought a Crucial 4 MB ram upgrade and the Intel 6235 Network Centrino Wifi card with Bluetooth.  The Windows 8.1 took several hours to upgrade, and everything seems to be working fine.  I am very pleased with the purchase and hope that it lasts.

Reviews.Title: Pretty decent.
Reviews.Author: Andrew A. Ayton "Andrew8n"
Reviews.Content: I wanted a touch screen laptop for my studies at University. This laptop runs really cool, And the fan is muted. The touchscreen is very responsive and the over all construction of the laptop feels solid. After frequent use, the laptop started booting faster and faster thanks to the hybrid hard drive. I would have given this laptop a full five stars but I took away a star due to the lack of consistency of the key board. Occasionally, the keyboard miss keystrokes. This usually happens when one is typing really fast. It takes some getting use to and one who have to ensure they press each key with enough force. Other than that, pretty Decent pick.

Reviews.Title: Fix to Wi-fi disconneting problems
Reviews.Author: S
Reviews.Content: I got this as a Christmas gift and it was something I needed as I start to write my thesis, but I definitely did notice the wifi disconnecting a lot - which is quite frustrating as a student always on the computer.I called Asus and they tried to tell me that it's because the airplane mode goes on by itself...please.  So I saw what one review said about uninstalling and reinstalling the wireless adapter. After some playing around, I finally fixed it on my own!First you need to make sure you haven an ethernet connection. If you have Windows 8, go to Computer Management -> Device Manager -> Network Adapters and uninstall the wireless adapter. Go to this website and choose the appropriate (and most recent) OS and adapter: [...]You will be told you need to download Asus installer. After doing that, the adapter downloads automatically. Save it, extract all the zip files, and then click the file named "Setup". Upon the completion of the installation process, your adapter is installed! Go back to Computer Management and right click on network Adapters and select "Scan for hardware changes" and your new adapter should pop up.Hopefully this should help a some people out and allow this ultrabook to get the 5 stars it deserves :)

Reviews.Title: Great Buy ! No regrets
Reviews.Author: Ricardo Campbell
Reviews.Content: Great Buy even though I had to install a extra 4gb RamLove the touch screen, so accurate and easy to use

Reviews.Title: Great Ultrabook!
Reviews.Author: Katy, Texas.
Reviews.Content: My son loves it! it is powerful and fast... Easy to use, the touchscreen is great, you only need to update to Windows 8.1.

Reviews.Title: Performs as I had Expected
Reviews.Author: Guopin Jack Chen
Reviews.Content: The touch screen is responsive, the process for all applications that I run is fast, and I haven't had issue with it so far. With the price of around $550, there is nothing I can complain.

Reviews.Title: Great Quality but no DVD
Reviews.Author: Jonathan L. Fortner "pcgeekus"
Reviews.Content: I realize no DVD drive is becoming more standard, but you must have one to load older software. Also, I would've like to have had 8GB of memory and blue tooth. So far, it works great and solve my Wife's issues she had with her XP based Toshiba laptop which practically locks up if you leave a browser open. The touchscreen is responsive and helps since the touchpad takes a bit to get used to.

Reviews.Title: Great
Reviews.Author: Sarah Foster
Reviews.Content: Very sleek, easy to start up and use. I end up touching all computer screens now that I'm used to having this one with touchscreen technology.I'd definitely recommend getting more memory space. Otherwise, it does anything you need it to.

Reviews.Title: love it
Reviews.Author: Lovely
Reviews.Content: this is a great laptop so far no problems..  it just doesn't have back lit keys...  otherwise great little laptop for a great price..

Reviews.Title: Love my Asus, I use it for work and love it
Reviews.Author: B. H. C. Ruffing "CRuffing"
Reviews.Content: Love my Asus tablet, great for my needs.  I love using tablets and having the touch screen.  It fits my needs

Reviews.Title: Touchscreen really nice !
Reviews.Author: Hugo Andres Junyent
Reviews.Content: I bought this item for my girlfriend, really great product, she uses just media stuff and really loves the touchscreen; also, windows 8 is great for her.

Reviews.Title: Great notebook
Reviews.Author: Chen-Jih Lui
Reviews.Content: This notebook was devilvered on time. It perform well with good style. I update graded it to windows 8.1 and internet connection. Us good also

Reviews.Title: Very nice style, performance mediocre though.
Reviews.Author: steve
Reviews.Content: Glad I didn't pay more than $500.  Minor freezes and programs not responding right out of the box with no programs on it. Beautiful and quiet though.

Reviews.Title: Ideally sized computer
Reviews.Author: Natalie Horowitz
Reviews.Content: Ideal for students and people a lot and for aAmazing user experienceWriting a paper or lecture notes became a game :)

Reviews.Title: Good Computer
Reviews.Author: Watercube
Reviews.Content: I bought is on Black Friday and the price is only $499 before tax. After using it for several days, I liked it very much. It's not heavy. It's fast. It's convenient. But the time for setting all system up took me a whole day. Also it doesn't have Microsoft Office so be prepared to get one from other sources.

Reviews.Title: Great value for the price
Reviews.Author: Eraj
Reviews.Content: This is a great laptop with touch screen for the price I paid. Build quality is good and the touch screen works well with Windows 8.

Reviews.Title: Very nice laptop
Reviews.Author: CW
Reviews.Content: The feel and look are very good. Widows 8 is interesting a real learning curve. The touch screen is very responsive. My only concern is with Asus as I bought another 14 inch notebook from Asus and when the laptop didn't work well after updating windows I called asus and they said the machine was working but the software was corrupted and it might have been shipped that way. To fix the problem I needed to buy a service plan to fix the software issue on a 2 day old laptop that said could have been defective when shipped. I returned (RMA) the laptop to the vendor (not Amazon). Not sure if I would buy another ASUS due to their customer service. I would rate the laptop 5 stars but did not due my experience with ASUS customer service.

Reviews.Title: Great value for your money
Reviews.Author: Lani Garnace
Reviews.Content: Great laptop for an affordable price! Lightweight which is good since I carry it everyday. Try to upgrade the ram for an improved performance.

Reviews.Title: I Love It
Reviews.Author: Robert
Reviews.Content: Best thing I have bought since a new pairs of boxers. Perfect tool for school and trying to get my work done in a fast fashion.

Reviews.Title: The Perfect Christmas Present
Reviews.Author: King Bob
Reviews.Content: I bought this laptop for my son - for use in college.  My son says that the laptop itself is perfect - it's got all the features he needs.  It's also lightweight and thin.  I deducted one star because the initial setup is rather tedious.  The laptop ships with Windows 8, and it took 2-3 hours to upgrade it to Windows 8.1.  I'm not sure if Win 8.1 is much different, but the all-important Facebook tile app would not work in Win 8.  Once we got it upgraded, the laptop worked great.  We didn't have any issues with the wifi, as some reviewers noted.

Reviews.Title: Good
Reviews.Author: Amarnath
Reviews.Content: Laptop is good and very handy but i dint like the keyboard. Not user friendly. But touchscreen is very cool.

Reviews.Title: Not bad overall
Reviews.Author: Jeremy Vancil
Reviews.Content: I have to say this is pretty nice. Gestures and touchscreen are taking a little time to get used to and I hate Windows 8 with a burning passion.That being said wifi has been rock solid (a major concern after reading some of these reviews). Get rid of the built in anti-virus asap as it bogs down terribly. Keyboard is quite good. Overall this is a great value purchase.Slightly louder fan than anticipated despite temperature not being elevated at all. Performance is pretty good and I've got a 4 GB stick of ram which should help significantly.

Reviews.Title: Defective, noisy laptop with serious battery life
Reviews.Author: N Shetty
Reviews.Content: One of worst laptop by far!!!.  I can't believe  a brand new laptop can hold charge just for 2 hours !!!  To add to my worries it used to produce a grilling  sound (.. which was by no means fan). Hence I got it replaced by ordering the same model. To my surprise the new model was no good .....it got hung up within few days... No more ASUS for me

Reviews.Title: Works ok
Reviews.Author: Leonard S.
Reviews.Content: For a low budget laptop it works ok, Has problems staying online.  Sometimes I have to log onto a web site 2 or 3 times to get on.  If you just need a laptop to work on for school work , office work, or word processing it will do the job.  But if you do a lot of stuff online, I wouldn't recommend this laptop.  I bought this laptop as a 2nd to take out in the field for work, wouldn't buy this as a primary.

Reviews.Title: Very Simple Review
Reviews.Author: Paul Pembroke "Cup A Joe"
Reviews.Content: Simply put: This is a terrific laptop! Everything is above par considering how affordable it is.ONLY ONE complaint: the track pad is pretty bad. Way too sensitive and often not working properly. Even after installing new software and changing the sensitivity settings, it is way too responsive, also opening windows and apps by accident.

Reviews.Title: Clean and elegant
Reviews.Author: Al
Reviews.Content: Nice laptop, clean cut, a little above avergae performance, good looking. The only problem is the windows 8 (just because sucks) The hardware works very well, sometimes the trackpad can be kind f clumsy. Overall is a good computer

Reviews.Title: great
Reviews.Author: raj patel
Reviews.Content: It works great. Its fast. The only thinhg is it doesn't have cd or dvd drive.OOther than that works great.

Reviews.Title: Decent, could be better with minor adjustments.
Reviews.Author: Badadesi "badadesi"
Reviews.Content: I bought this for my dad.  The machine is light and appears to be sturdy.  The trackpad could be better designed.

Reviews.Title: i5, touchscreen, windows 8, HDMI hook -up for crisp and clean video conversion what else should I say!
Reviews.Author: cju747
Reviews.Content: I was searching for days on the type of laptop I wanted my amazing 13 to have, and This is deffently the one that will make her go WOW!!!! I5 1.7 is possibly the greatest idea for speed and windows 8 goes great with the processor! Im only upset its not X64 bit for memory upgrade down the road but for 550$ and a touch screen that is not limited like the detachable ones are I will not complain at all! I am only upset I didn't buy myself one!

Reviews.Title: ASUS a bad choice
Reviews.Author: Steven Vollmer
Reviews.Content: The battery would never fully charge and would not hold what little charge it did have for long.  The computer repeatedly froze up.  There was not one piece of paperwork with the unit giving any instructions regarding its use.We have already returned the item to Amazon and gone with a different brand.

Reviews.Title: Would be great except for scrolling problems
Reviews.Author: Maya
Reviews.Content: I got used to the reverse scrolling (which I WISH could be changed), but ever since I downloaded Windows 8.1, the scrolling feature on the touchpad randomly stops working. It's like if I open the laptop and immediately try doing something, the scroll fails. And then I have to restart to get it working again. I've tried tech support, which fixes the problem temporarily, but it's always come back so far. Even when it does work, there's always a lag I have to wait when I open the laptop up before it starts working.Otherwise, I'm getting used to Windows 8, though I don't use apps much. Everything else is good. I do wish there was a way to keep a clock on the screen though, instead of manually having to pull it up all the time.

Reviews.Title: Nice laptop, but wifi adaptor doesn't work
Reviews.Author: Jessie
Reviews.Content: Overall, this is a great computer, very light and look like Air. The only thing I will complain is the wifi adaptor, which doesn't work at all, I have to order a USB wifi adaptor myself so that this laptop could really do its job,who want a laptop that cannot connect to internet? I suggest asus put a USB wifi adaptor in the box, sigh...So for people who's considering this laptop, be prepare the wifi adaptor won't work, either change it or buy a USB adaptor or just don't buy this laptop. Since updating the adaptor drivers doesn't work at all

Reviews.Title: Returned it almost immediately
Reviews.Author: S. E. Kelvington
Reviews.Content: I bought this laptop looking for a replacement to my compact Lenovo X220 laptop. I wanted something solid (not cheap feeling plastic) with a nice touch pad that I could travel with easily. This laptop looked good, so I thought I'd try it out. I'll start with what I didn't like:As soon as I turned it on I regretted my purchase. The screen on this laptop is worse then bad. It boggles the mind to think that someone would approve a screen this bad looking for a product. It's bright, has nice color representation, and has great viewing angles, but the 1366x768 resolution is far, FAR too low for a 14 inch screen. When holding it at arm's length or using it on my lap I could see individual pixels! That's not an exaggeration. It was like looking at a 1080p TV from a distance of six inches. Small fonts were very difficult to read, and large fonts had jagged edges. It's the same resolution as my old Lenovo, but it's astonishing how much worse it looks on this laptop. I've never had this problem with any computer I've used before. First I thought there was a plastic protector sheet on the screen that I'd missed, or that it must be something Windows 8 does to render fonts differently and it must be misconfigured. Nope, the screen is actually that bad. I checked the display configuration hoping that it was somehow set to 640x480, but no, it was at the screen's native resolution. I ran the Windows ClearType tool and it didn't change a thing. It's not just fonts that looked bad; everything appeared grainy. The display looked so bad that I immediately knew I wouldn't be able to use this laptop.The touch pad was also not what I had hoped. It looks nice, but after using it for a couple of hours it left me with the feeling that corners were cut while building it. Physically "clicking" requires far too much force and it only works along the very bottom edge of the touch pad. The clicking action is also not that great; when clicking, the bottom of the pad lurches into the laptop case with a horrible (and surprisingly loud!) sound. It does this every single time you click and didn't "break in." The ASUS software to configure the touch pad is, as expected, bad. The multi-touch touch pad gestures worked most of the time, but not all. Overall the touch pad seemed to be a shoddy copy of an Apple laptop touch pad that wasn't nearly as usable and clearly made on a tight budget.This laptop did have a few nice features. The solid aluminum case is very solid and had quality construction. It left me with the impression that this laptop would survive a fall off a table with ease. Even the ethernet port, built into the side and hinged to expand to fit an RJ45 plug, felt like a quality part. Hardware spec-wise, the hybrid SSD/HDD and i5 processor are both very nice, and I had no performance issues. More RAM would be a good addition, but the included 4GB is enough to make it usable. The included Windows 8 OS is a huge disappointment, but I don't want to focus on that and I don't hold it against the laptop. The touch screen is very functional and responsive but ultimately totally useless. It's a novelty to use a laptop with your fingers like it's a tablet, but after only a few minutes it became an arm-sore and made me think, "this is the worst way to hold an iPad." It's disappointing that laptop manufacturers are strong-armed by Microsoft into including useless touch screens on laptops, but again, I don't hold it against this laptop and it's not a factor of my review score.Overall, I'd recommend not buying this laptop. The solid aluminum construction and decent specs aren't enough to make up for the abysmal screen and cheap touch pad.

Reviews.Title: Nice laptop, terrible operating system
Reviews.Author: Fabio P.
Reviews.Content: The laptop is a great deal, in terms of hardware. The supplied operating system is tremendously slow and unusable. After formatting and deleting all the factory installed content, and installing Ubuntu, the laptop runs like a charm!

Reviews.Title: I'd look into some other options if you're considering.
Reviews.Author: Andrew
Reviews.Content: I'd look into some other options if you're considering.  The specs sounds great but performance is not.  I recently bought this laptop brand new, less than 1 month ago and have already had to reformat and lose everything I had on it.  It said to use the reformat disk included, which wasn't in the box, so had to call Asus and go through the 3 hour process.  On the surface it looks nice, but seems very slow, and already had a meltdown in less than 30 days when I barely use it.  I've previsouly owned Dell, Gateway, and Lenovo laptops and wishing I would have stuck with better brand as choosing the cheaper option, I seem to be getting what I paid for, a cheap laptop. Windows 8 is pretty bad as well, but that's not Asus's fault.

Reviews.Title: Couldn't turn on
Reviews.Author: PP
Reviews.Content: Couldn't even turn on the laptop right out of the box. Charged for 3 hours like the instructions said, still no response...

Reviews.Title: Defective
Reviews.Author: Shekar
Reviews.Content: Received a defective piece. The reason I am posting this review is because I read one more person having the same experience and I feel it is important to know if this is a regular issue. Reflects on the company's QA/QC. The issue is that the laptop makes a distinct screeching noise.

Reviews.Title: BAD EXPERIENCE
Reviews.Author: Venkatesh
Reviews.Content: I got a defective piece that doesn't even power on. I have charged it for more than 10 hrs and it still doesn't power on. I called up Asus and they have asked me to ship it back to them.

Reviews.Title: Not well functioning keyboard.
Reviews.Author: Pham Tran Duc Anh
Reviews.Content: I really love this device so I decided to order it on black Friday. However, it turned out to be a bad product because the back space button. It is not well functioning and it requires much force to make it work. I am really unhappy because they don't have any others left to replace. It's just too bad.

Reviews.Title: It could be a good laptop if one uses it only for internet browsing ...
Reviews.Author: Wolfpacker
Reviews.Content: It could  be a  good laptop if one uses it for internet browsing using touch screen. For all other purposes which involves typing it could be a little flimsy. Keyboard is the biggest let down. I had to press some keys really hard. I made the following changes to this laptop so that it could be used for just browsing internet.Upgraded the OS to Windows 8.1.  Windows 8 was very slow and ofcourse the user experience is horrible.To resolve the  WiFi dropping issue I tried Upgrading the BIOS to the latest version from ASUS website. After the  BIOS  upgrade things were much better.

Reviews.Title: Good price for the money but no system back up
Reviews.Author: Andrea L. Mcbride "Mark McBride"
Reviews.Content: This machine is pretty good for the money.  It operates well.  The main reason it gets two stars is there is no provided way to back up the operating system.  I called Asus and they told me they do not support data backup.  I advised them I was not concerned about data but am concerned about the operating system in the event of a hard drive failure.  Asus told me it is backed up on a hidden patrician on the hard drive in the event of a failure.  I explained that is nice but if the hard drive has crashed or is inoperable, you cannot restore this system.  Asus stated you would need to send it in for repair in that event.  This might sound minor to some but it can happen and if the hard drive fails, you might end up buying a new computer as sending it in for repair doesn't sound cheap.  Asus should support, like many other computer manufactures, a system restore disk creator.

Reviews.Title: Keyboard/touchpad are BAD
Reviews.Author: pfz3
Reviews.Content: To begin as soon as I received this I wiped the harddrive and did a clean install of WIN8.1. Afterwards I installed all necessary drivers (gestures, touchpad, graphics, etc..). The bloatware is bad but not terribly bad (see Dell, HP, etc..). After a fresh install the ram when from 50% used during idle to 25% used (on 4GB ram which I suppose is a good improvement). I love the aluminum design and think that for the money the laptop is decent.However... the touchpad and keyboard on my unit are absolutely HORRIBLE. The right-click button sometimes does not work or mistakes the click as a left click. I have installed the latest drivers and the problem persists. I am convinced this is a hardware issue. The keyboard OFTEN misses key-strokes. Again, I am fairly certain that this is a hardware issue as I can "feel" that the key does not press all the way day when it does miss-fire. Usually this occurs most often on keys in the middle of the keyboard - I suspect that the lack of rigidity in the middle requires much harder pressing to get the sensor to register a stroke. You can see the aluminum chassis deflects more in the middle (shame... some internal spacers would have easily resolved this). Conclusion: THIS KEYBOARD IS VERY ANNOYING IF YOU OFTEN DO WORD PROCESSING OR WRITE EMAILS!! i.e. 90% of what laptops are used for. I understand this is a budget laptop, but a functioning keyboard should be #1 concern for a designer and touchpad #2. This is how the user interfaces w the product...Overall I am somewhat annoyed. I am considering returning the product (if I can) and shell out the bucks for a Zenbook.

Reviews.Title: I bought a new, give me a refurbished.
Reviews.Author: feng terry
Reviews.Content: I request a refund of the difference, but it was rejected.I do not know why they would make such a mistake, and I also want to know why this error they appear. But they did not give me a reasonable explanation. I do not know who is responsible for this reason, but I indeed received a refurbished computer.I hope you do not go to deceive consumers, and I want to refund the difference is a reasonable request, but I do not know why the request was rejected.I am very disappointed.

Reviews.Author: Tram Nguyen
Reviews.Content: I've purchased this laptop couple days and used it only 1 days. The AC adapter suddenly stopped working for no reason.

Reviews.Title: Not a fan for performance and price!!
Reviews.Author: naveed pirzada
Reviews.Content: Biggest issue with this laptop is that average memory uses is  50% without using any programs.  I bought my dad Asus X501A RH31 for $280 at Frys electronics and it outperforms S400CA by far on memory uses as it only uses 1 - 1.3 GIG on average so plenty available for other programs so I am disappointed  on memory performance for S400CA laptop.  I would upgrade the memory, but spending $580 on this already and adding average cost of $50 for memory upgrade may not be worth the cost for some people. Only positive thing about this laptop is that you can push battery usage up to 6 hours based on  battery saving mode.  Overall I think  cost for this laptop is too high for it's performance.

Reviews.Title: Noisy hhd (defective porduct)
Reviews.Author: Bruno Coutinho
Reviews.Content: Mine was defective. The hhd was too noise. I do not believe that it is a problem of the product in general.

Reviews.Title: I hate Microsoft
Reviews.Author: Paulina Esquer
Reviews.Content: Windows 8 sucks and there is no online support provided by my Microsoft!!I wish I knew that Windows8 sucks that much before I purchase this laptopalso there is no support provided by ASUS, and no support from AmazonI will never buy something like this from Amazon in my life!
